item.title: 208-year jail sentence over school collapse in Mexico quake
item.description: A Mexican court has sentenced a man who approved flawed construction work at a school where 26 people died in a 2017 earthquake to 208 years in prison, prosecutors said.

item.title: White House slams Facebook as conduit for COVID-19 misinformation
item.description: Facebook is not doing enough to stop the spread of false claims about COVID-19 and vaccines, White House press secretary Jen Psaki said on Thursday, part of a new administration pushback on misinformation in the United States.

item.title: Oregon blaze threatens 2,000 homes as new wildfires erupt in western states
item.description: Firefighters struggled on Thursday to contain a massive Oregon fire that has displaced hundreds of residents, as new blazes erupted in neighboring states in an unusually early start to the western wildfire season.

item.title: COVID-19 infections on the rise worldwide - report
item.description: New COVID-19 infections have been on the rise across the world since late June, topping half a million on Tuesday and Wednesday, increases not seen since May 28, according to an AFP tally.

item.title: Naka-quarantine na inang OFW, nagmakaawa na payagan siyang makapunta sa libing ng anak
item.description: Nakiusap ang isang inang overseas Filipino worker (OFW) na igsian ang kaniyang quarantine period para makapiling kahit sandali ang anak na biglang pumanaw noong nakaraang linggo.

item.title: Tiny house na may sukat lang na 5.5 sqm sa Baguio City, hindi dapat ismolin
item.description: Bukod sa maliit nilang jeepney, agaw-pansin ngayon sa Baguio City ang maliit na bahay na tinawag na "Tank House" na may sukat lang na sa 5.5 sq meters.

item.title: Calamba local exec survives ambush try
item.description: A local official in Calamba, Laguna survived an ambush in the province, according to a State of the Nation report on Thursday. In the report, the local official was identified as Jeffrey Rodriguez, chief of Public Order and Safety Office, which enforces local ordinance in the city, including COVID-19 safety protocols.

item.title: Saudi smashes COVID-19 fraud ring ahead of hajj
item.description: Saudi Arabia has arrested more than 120 people suspected of supplying or procuring fraudulent coronavirus vaccine and test certificates, official media said Thursday, two days before a tightly controlled hajj.

item.title: Hepe ng Public Order and Safety Office ng Calamba, ligtas sa ambush; pero 3 ang sugatan
item.description: Naging biktima ng karahasan ang mismong hepe ng Public Order and Safety Office ng Calamba, Laguna matapos siyang tambangan. Bagaman nakaligtas ang opisyal, tatlo naman ang nasugatan, kabilang isang babaeng napadaan lang sa lugar

item.title: Philippines tightens borders amid COVID-19 surge in Indonesia
item.description: “Na-notify na lahat ng ating mga law enforcement kasama diyan ang Coast Guard at Philippine Navy na magbantay,” Foreign Affairs Undersecretary Brigido Dulay said.“Napaka-porous ng border natin sa South. So yun naman ang magagawa lang natin doon ay mas matinding pagbabantay,” he added.

item.title: China should provide raw data on COVID-19 pandemic's origins - WHO's Tedros
item.description: The head of the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Thursday that investigations into the origins of the COVID-19 pandemic in China were being hampered by the lack of raw data on the first days of spread there and urged it to be more transparent.

item.title: Mayor Isko Moreno, inihayag kung kanino lang siya 'takot'
item.description: Inihayag ni Manila Mayor Isko Moreno nitong Huwebes na walang puwedeng manakot o manduro sa kaniya kaugnay sa kaniyang magiging desisyon kung anong posisyon ang tatakbuhan niya sa Eleksyon 2022.

item.title: Picnic ends in tragedy as cousins drown in Bulacan river
item.description: A picnic ended in tragedy for three cousins who drowned in a river in Sta. Maria, Bulacan.

item.title: Risk of COVID-19 spread is zero, IOC chief says, amid rising Tokyo cases
item.description: International Olympic Committee President Thomas Bach said on Thursday there was "zero" risk of Games participants infecting Japanese residents with COVID-19, as cases hit a six-month high in the host city.

item.title: P10-B ayuda na 'di umano naipamahagi ng DSWD, pinaimbestigahan ni Pacquiao sa Senado
item.description: Naghain na ng resolusyon si Senador Manny Pacquiao upang pormal na hilingin sa Senado na imbestigahan ang kabiguan umano ng Department of Social Welfare and Development na ipamahagi ang P10.4 bilyong halaga ng Social Amelioration Program funds o "ayuda."
